title: Product diversity under monopoly: two high-quality results
abstract: A mild relaxation of Mussa and Rosen's (1978) preference assumption implies that, contrary to their result, a monopoly selling a line of vertically differentiated goods may include higher-quality varieties than would a competitive industry
